input_args.examples: {'document_id': ['0005553', '0005553', '0005553', '0005234'], 'document_source': ['GARD', 'GARD', 'GARD', 'GARD'], 'document_url': ['https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/gard/31/serpiginous-choroiditis', 'https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/gard/31/serpiginous-choroiditis', 'https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/gard/31/serpiginous-choroiditis', 'https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/gard/226/rabson-mendenhall-syndrome'], 'category': [None, None, None, None], 'umls_cui': ['C0729842', 'C0729842', 'C0729842', 'C0271695'], 'umls_semantic_types': ['T047', 'T047', 'T047', 'T047'], 'umls_semantic_group': ['Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders'], 'synonyms': ['Geographic choroiditis|Geographic helicoid peripapillary choroidopathy (GHPC)|Geographic serpiginous choroiditis|Peripapillary choriopathy|Serpiginous choroidopathy', 'Geographic choroiditis|Geographic helicoid peripapillary choroidopathy (GHPC)|Geographic serpiginous choroiditis|Peripapillary choriopathy|Serpiginous choroidopathy', 'Geographic choroiditis|Geographic helicoid peripapillary choroidopathy (GHPC)|Geographic serpiginous choroiditis|Peripapillary choriopathy|Serpiginous choroidopathy', 'Pineal hyperplasia, insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus, and somatic abnormalities|Mendenhall Syndrome'], 'question_id': ['0005553-2', '0005553-3', '0005553-4', '0005234-1'], 'question_focus': ['Serpiginous choroiditis', 'Serpiginous choroiditis', 'Serpiginous choroiditis', 'Rabson-Mendenhall syndrome'], 'question_type': ['causes', 'inheritance', 'treatment', 'information'], 'question': ['What causes Serpiginous choroiditis ?', 'Is Serpiginous choroiditis inherited ?', 'What are the treatments for Serpiginous choroiditis ?', 'What is (are) Rabson-Mendenhall syndrome ?'], 'answer': ['What causes serpiginous choroiditis? The cause of serpiginous choroiditis is unknown. Speculation exists regarding an association with exposure to various toxic compounds and/or infectious agents. Some researchers believe the condition is related to an organ-specific autoimmune inflammatory process.', 'Can I inherit serpiginous choroiditis if my mother has the condition? No familial predillection or propensity has been described.', 'Is there any treatment for serpiginous choroiditis? There are a few treatment options for individuals with serpiginous choroiditis. Treatment may involve an anti-inflammatory medication, such as prednisone, or an immune system suppressing combination of prednisone, cyclosporine, and azathioprine. Additionally, the role of cyclosporine alone has been investigated. These treatments may be administered for a long period of time to prevent recurrences. A serious complication of serpiginous choroiditis is choroidal neovascularization. Laser photocoagulation or surgery may be helpful in some of these cases.', 'Rabson-Mendenhall syndrome is a genetic disorder characterized by severe insulin resistance. Insulin, a hormone produced by the pancreas, regulates blood sugar levels by promoting the movement of glucose into cells for energy production or into the liver and fat cells for storage. Symptoms of Rabson-Mendenhall syndrome may include intrauterine and postnatal growth retardation, hypertrophy of muscle and fat tissues, abnormalities of the head and face, abnormalities of the teeth and nails, and skin abnormalities such as acanthosis nigricans. Additional symptoms may also be present. Rabson-Mendenhall syndrome is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. Treatment is difficult and may include high doses of insulin and/or recombinant insulin-like growth factor.']}
